alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 8:05PM CDT until April 02 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Cuivre River near Troy. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cuivre River near Troy. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Near this height, State Highway H near the West Fork Cuivre River bridge will be closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 23.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 22.4 feet and begin rising again early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 23.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Cuivre River Troy 21.0 21.2 Wed 7 pm 22.2 13.0 9.0 8.2 7.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
